remarks.format:
## 解説 When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> is created, it adds a transparent window over the designer frame. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can then use this window to render user interface elements, called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects, as well as catch all mouse messages. In this way, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can control designer behavior.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> class supports a behavior stack, onto which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior> objects can be pushed. When a message is intercepted through the transparent window, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can send the message to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior> at the top of the stack. This enables different user interface modes depending on the currently pushed <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> is used to render all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects, such as selection borders, sizing handles, and smart tags. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> also controls many design\-time behaviors, such as using snaplines, dragging, and selecting.
For more information, see [Behavior Service Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/7c60cc41-4324-46b5-b444-b39eda7cb33f).

## 解説 Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/a17b0066-71c2-4ba4-9822-8e19332fc213) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/eb4e1af0-3b48-4fbc-ad4e-fc2f64138bf9).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
